page.title: 19SLAWSTON
page.content: 81 people live in{Slawston.}There are two large and two small mixed farms surrounding the village, as well as Othorpe Manor. Apart from farmers, there are two farm workers, seven businessmen, three builders, an electrician, a schoolteacher and salesmen living in the village. Very few of the villagers were born there and many work outside the immediate area. Slawston is almost a one street village, attractive with very little new building - only four new houses since the war - but no shops now. There is a village hall where the WI meet and village activities take place. The threat of having the church declared redundant has caused over 90% of the residents to try to raise Â£30,000 to pay for essential repairs. About eight attend the weekly service, although all go to the Harvest Supper.
